meanings.definition: The activity or profession of writing plays.
meanings.sent1: Her passion for playwriting led her to write numerous scripts for local theaters.
meanings.sent2: I have always been interested in playwriting and hope to pursue it as a career.
meanings.sent3: After years of playwriting, she finally achieved her dream of having a play produced on Broadway.
meanings.sent4: In the world of playwriting, every word written is like a brushstroke on a canvas, creating a vivid picture for the audience.
meanings.sent5: The art of playwriting requires a deep understanding of character development and dialogue.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a written work intended for performance on stage.
meanings.sent1: His playwriting skills were evident in the way he crafted compelling stories for the theater.
meanings.sent2: The workshop focused on the fundamentals of playwriting and how to structure a play effectively.
meanings.sent3: The playwriting class was full of aspiring writers eager to learn the craft.
meanings.sent4: Her playwriting style was like a symphony, with each scene building to a crescendo of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The magic of playwriting is bringing characters to life on stage through words and actions.
